alert.note: Alert for Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 4:55PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 545 PM MST... At 455 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over San Tan Valley, or 12 miles southwest of Gold Canyon. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Gilbert, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport, San Tan Mountain Park, Magma, and San Tan Valley. This includes the following highways... US Highway 60 near mile marker 205. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 35 and 37. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Apache Junction, Gold Canyon; East Valley; Northwest Pinal County; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek
